I own a website domain. Can I host a DMP server on it (on the website server)?

Edited April 20, 2015 by Engineer Of Stuff

Hello - it's probably better to ask in the DMP thread as I miss things like this.

This is pretty generic information as it applies to most servers, but it depends on what type of host you have. First I'll explain it locally and then I'll explain how to do it remotely.

To run a DMP server locally, just extract DMPServer.zip and run it - the default config is for a stock sandbox server.

To get people from the internet to join it, you'll then need to port forward.

In order to run it remotely you'll need shell/terminal access, if this is just a website host then then this may not be possible to do. If you do have shell/terminal access though, you should be able to download DMPServer to it and run it - if it's a linux host you'll need to install 'mono-complete' on debian or ubuntu.

*Port forwarding is not required for internet hosts such as remote servers.
